lexUnit.name: scrutinize.v

corpus.description: Wall Street Journal Texts from the PropBank Project
corpus.name: PropBank

lexUnit.definition: COD: examine or inspect closely and thoroughly.

sentence.text: He scrutinised her for a moment .
She stopped and looked at the other three who were scrutinising her in amused silence .
He was scrutinising her openly in return .
On that day we scrutinised all the temporary folders in the box and noted the time that had elapsed since the proper notes had been requested .
Nelson 's had just issued a short book of mine on Turkey , and he scrutinized it with care , holding it high up and bending back the spine as if to test its durability .
Dana ignored her sister 's pin-prick and , taking a mirror from her bag , scrutinised her perfect complexion with minute care .
Mortimer scrutinized her with narrowed eyes , then nodded to himself .
Dexter took the jacket to the window so that he could scrutinise the cuff by natural light .

The builder should be summoned to scrutinize the small growth on the pantry 's outer wall , and her husband had informed her that the bank had made another balls-up and requested her to deal with it .
Two locals were scrutinising the forthcoming attractions outside the tiny cinema in Glenarm , Co .
The guard scrutinized it carefully before handing it back .
How on earth does Parliament scrutinise an Act with only one clause ?
The policeman scrutinized the card .
Dexter asked impassively , scrutinising every hair , every pore , on Marek 's face .
Iris scrutinised her , eagle-eyed .
Sybil scrutinised the list .
Basil scrutinized the painting , pointed to the steps and asked , " Is this all Caroline 's work ? "
As a result of a number of miscarriages , we are scrutinising our system of justice .
Willie drew the two lines again and , while carefully scrutinizing the new word , copied it .
It was during that time the lady Primaflora was summoned to the palace at Nicosia to be scrutinised by the King 's mother .
Even the jewels which Lovat bought as gifts were scrutinised carefully by the fierce mentor , to make sure that they were adequate and sufficiently costly .
Their draft is scrutinised by the Legislation Committee of the Cabinet .
People holding loud parties or operating noisy machinery will be closely scrutinised by the council 's environmental health officers .
The exercise of statutory powers was closely scrutinized and any procedural or substantive defect was generally found to be sufficient to nullify a decision .
Teaching material is scrutinised for equal representation of gender in illustrations and text .
Cardiotocography records are carefully scrutinised and sometimes pivotal in expensive legal actions .
Pam hugged me and we scrutinised each other 's wardrobe , as usual .
Scrutinise the fiction and poetry being published this year .
The woman scrutinized her briefly .
Other ITV stations will closely scrutinise the small print when further details are released in a few weeks .
The field of housing is seldom scrutinised for its attitudes to older people .
Of the methods scrutinised in this book , studying is one of the most impersonal .
By December the press , heavily scrutinized by Mussolini , kept a very low profile about it .
The main hull and its two sideswimmers , with their secondary propellers , were carefully scrutinised .
This type of biography must be particularly carefully scrutinized since it may be lacking in much criticism of its subject .
Apart from personal attacks , overseas materials in the English language departments were also scrutinised .
The Lords quite freely use their modest powers to scrutinise and amend non-financial bills sent to them by Tories in the Commons .
Clearly , members without ministerial office may participate in all of these stages , and Opposition members will take particular care to scrutinize and attack government action .
Later I turned a page and uttered a gasp of stunned surprise that made Edward look up from the manuscript he scrutinized .
They should see to it that their kids do n't play truant ; they should make certain that the children spend enough time doing homework ; they should scrutinize the report card .
